course.description_en: Meet friendly farm animals and learn their sounds. Discover what animals give us and how farmers care for them.
course.description_ar: تعرف على حيوانات المزرعة الودودة وتعلم أصواتها. اكتشف ما تعطينا الحيوانات وكيف يعتني بها المزارعون.
course.subject: science

content_data.title: Bella the Happy Cow
content_data.content: This is Bella. Bella is a cow. Bella says MOO! Bella is big. Bella is black and white. Bella lives on a farm. Bella eats green grass. Bella gives us milk. Milk is good for you. Bella likes to walk in the field. Bella has a long tail. Bella waves her tail. MOO says Bella!
content_data.parent_guidance: Point to cow pictures while reading. Make 'moo' sounds together. Show child a glass of milk and explain it comes from cows. Keep sessions short if child gets restless.
safety_notes: Ensure toy cow has no small parts

extension_activities.title: Moo Like a Cow
extension_activities.description: Take turns making cow sounds. March around like a big cow.

extension_activities.title: Find Cow Colors
extension_activities.description: Look for black and white things around the house.

content_data.title: Mama Hen and Her Chicks
content_data.content: This is Mama Hen. Mama Hen says CLUCK CLUCK! Mama Hen is red and brown. Here are baby chicks. Chicks are yellow and fluffy. Chicks say PEEP PEEP! Mama Hen takes care of babies. She keeps them warm. She finds them food. Chickens give us eggs. Eggs are good to eat. Roosters say COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! Roosters wake up the farm.
content_data.parent_guidance: Show different chicken sounds - cluck for hen, peep for chicks, crow for rooster. Let child feel cotton balls to understand 'fluffy'. If showing real egg, hold it safely.

extension_activities.title: Chicken Walk
extension_activities.description: Walk around flapping arms like chicken wings. Make clucking sounds.

extension_activities.title: Make Fluffy Chicks
extension_activities.description: Stick yellow cotton balls on paper to make chicks.

content_data.title: Rolling in Mud Like Pigs
content_data.content: Pigs are pink and round. Pigs say OINK OINK! Pigs like to roll in mud. Mud keeps pigs cool. Pigs are very smart. Pigs have curly tails. Let's pretend to be pigs! Roll on the soft carpet. Make oink sounds. Wiggle like a pig tail.
learning_objectives: Understand pigs roll in mud to stay cool
content_data.parent_guidance: Demonstrate safe rolling on carpet. Explain that pigs roll in mud but we don't. Make it playful and fun. Stop if child gets too excited.
discussion_questions: Why do pigs roll in mud?
What shape is a pig's tail?

extension_activities.title: Pig Tail Dance
extension_activities.description: Hold pink paper behind you like a tail. Wiggle and dance.

extension_activities.title: Pink Hunt
extension_activities.description: Find pink things around the house like pigs.

content_data.title: Fluffy the Sheep
content_data.content: This is Fluffy the sheep. Fluffy says BAA BAA! Fluffy is white and woolly. Wool is very soft. Sheep give us wool. Wool keeps us warm. We make sweaters from wool. We make blankets from wool. Sheep like to eat grass. Sheep stay together in groups. Baby sheep are called lambs. Lambs are very cute!
content_data.parent_guidance: Let child feel wool clothing to understand texture. Use cotton balls to show 'fluffy'. Make 'baa' sounds together. Show how wool keeps us warm.
discussion_questions: What do we make from wool?

extension_activities.title: Sheep Sounds
extension_activities.description: Practice saying 'baa' in different ways - loud, soft, happy.

extension_activities.title: Fluffy Sheep Art
extension_activities.description: Glue cotton balls on paper to make a sheep.

content_data.title: Galloping Like Horses
content_data.content: Horses are big and strong. Horses say NEIGH! Horses can run very fast. Horses help farmers work. People can ride on horses. Horses eat hay and grass. Let's pretend to be horses! Get on hands and knees. Make clip-clop sounds. Gallop around the room. Neigh like a horse!
content_data.parent_guidance: Show child how to safely crawl like a horse. Make clip-clop sounds with spoons. Keep activity short to avoid tiredness. Demonstrate gentle galloping.

extension_activities.title: Horse Race
extension_activities.description: Crawl from one side of room to the other like horses racing.

extension_activities.title: Feed the Horse
extension_activities.description: Pretend to feed toy horse with play hay (shredded paper).

content_data.title: Ducky's Swimming Day
content_data.content: This is Ducky. Ducky says QUACK QUACK! Ducky is yellow and fluffy. Ducky loves to swim. Ducky lives near water. Ducky has webbed feet. Webbed feet help Ducky swim. Ducky dips her head in water. Ducky looks for food. Baby ducks follow Mama Duck. They swim in a line. Quack quack quack!
content_data.parent_guidance: Show how duck floats in water bowl. Let child make quack sounds. Explain webbed feet by showing fingers spread apart. Keep water play supervised.
discussion_questions: Where do ducks like to be?

extension_activities.title: Duck Waddle
extension_activities.description: Walk like a duck with feet turned out and arms as wings.

extension_activities.title: Floating Duck
extension_activities.description: Put toy duck in water and watch it float.

content_data.title: What Sound Do I Make?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun game! I will tell you about an animal. You tell me what sound it makes!
content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions slowly. Give hints if needed. Celebrate every answer. Make the sounds together. Keep it fun, not stressful.
discussion_questions: I am big and black and white. I give milk. What sound do I make?
I am small and yellow. I swim in water. What sound do I make?
I am pink and I roll in mud. What sound do I make?
I am white and fluffy. I give wool. What sound do I make?
I am big and strong. People ride on me. What sound do I make?
I lay eggs. I have a red comb. What sound do I make?

extension_activities.title: Animal Sound Symphony
extension_activities.description: Make all the animal sounds together in a fun song.

extension_activities.title: Guess the Animal
extension_activities.description: Parent makes animal sound, child guesses which animal.

content_data.title: Our Big Farm Parade
content_data.content: Let's have a parade! We will be all the farm animals. First, be a cow. Say MOO and walk slowly. Next, be a chicken. Flap your wings and say CLUCK. Then be a pig. Crawl and say OINK. Be a sheep and say BAA. Be a horse and gallop saying NEIGH. Be a duck and waddle saying QUACK. Great job! You know all the farm animals!
content_data.parent_guidance: Join the parade! Take turns being different animals. Encourage child to remember sounds and movements. Make it celebratory and fun. Praise effort, not perfection.
discussion_questions: Which animal was your favorite to be?
Which animal sound is the loudest?
Which animal was the hardest to copy?

extension_activities.title: Animal Family
extension_activities.description: Each family member picks a different farm animal to be.

extension_activities.title: Farm Animal Book
extension_activities.description: Look at farm animal books together and practice sounds.
